text: Ah yes, unfortunately, I'd need to get the upgraded number of contacts as well. Thank you though!

Hi   All!
I am solving a problem to attach files from external storage to HubSpot different objects records. I use API and this approach <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Attaching-files-to-object-via-the-APIs/m-p/727943> however it seems like there is a limit for uploading files into the file manager. I have about 3000 files but I am able to upload max 250 files.
I have noticed that if I attach an external file to the object manually it doesn't go to file manager but stays attached to the object.  Is there any solution for attaching big amount of files to object record via API?
Fantastic, thanks <@U01QVR44MEY> you were right. Both `hs_meeting_source`  and `hs_meeting_created_from_link_id` seems to have specific values for publicly booked meetings.

Hi guys!

Did anyone managed to bypass the if/else limitation when retrieving/uploading a workflow through the API?
Seems like when you fetch a workflow with several if/else branches it just get ignored/crop from the response. And I need to clone from one portal to another hundreds of them :cold_face:
<@UD53A9UUR>?
so if you fetch them, they don´t work anymore in the current portal, or in the new  portal?
in the new one, because the workflow is incomplete in the API GET

Hi guys :wave:

How are you feeling about code snippets in bots that are supporting the request library which is deprecated since 2020?

In workflows' custom code actions we have axios to achieve the same kind of http request to an api.

In code snippets for bots I don't see that. Do you use request at your own risk?

<https://www.npmjs.com/package/request>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/code-snippets-in-bots>

"noticed that if I attach an external file to the object manually", it still does go to the file manager it's just in a hidden folder for that object. So are you saying you can't upload files to the file manager through the api anymore?
Beautiful
Yeah sorry I couldn't be of more help
The account info api is do for an update, hopefully in the near future

<@U7ADCU3BM> can you DM me your portal IDs and workflow IDs (for the workflow you're copying from and the workflow you're copying to)? I can take a look at why the branches aren't showing up in the API
thank youu

So unfortunately the public workflows API doesn't fully support everything that's possible in the app right now. This is one of those limitations. The public workflows API only supports one set of filters for branches (basically an if-else) whereas in the app you can do an if-else if-else if-…-else.

This is on the team's radar and we're planning on releasing a revamped API that supports everything that you can do in the app (plus support for non-contact workflows), but unfortunately we don't have a timeline for what that will be ready yet.
The public workflows API will only return the first branch in an if-else if-… chain for a workflow that was created in the UI
so those hundreds of workflows will need to be rebuild by hand? or is there a way for HubSpot to still help users with such a problem?

You might be able to use <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/account/sync-automated-emails-forms-lists-and-workflows-to-a-standard-sandbox-account|sandbox sync> to sync the workflows between portals, but that requires an enterprise subscription AFAIK
That would only work to sync to and from a sandbox portal though unfortunately
thanks!
The portals are not originally related tho. This enterprise client is consolidating +14 portals into a huge one
If I get the workflow info through javascript in the UI can the API handle the creation of the branches?
Because I really need to bypass this limitation :disappointed:

Unfortunately the problem is that the public API format doesn't support multi-branching at all. I don't think there's a real workaround here other than sandbox portal sync. You could submit a ticket to support to see if the engineering team can help you out with copying these on a one-off basis, but I can't guarantee that it would be possible since I'm not sure if they have the infrastructure in place to copy between two portals in a generic way.

(There are other things that the public API doesn't support as well, e.g. non-contact workflows, go-to actions, and some newer action types. So it's possible that you'd run into limitations using the public API other than the multi-branch support.)
:sob:
<@U0157R7AQ84> Is there any rough timeline on when this would support other objects?  Even a Q3/Q4/Q1 2024 sort of thing would be great to know
Unfortunately no timeline. It's on the team's radar, likely for this year, but no guarantees on that :slightly_frowning_face:

I had a great week of trying to talk to HS Support about it before they closed the ticket on me xD I was like, "Hey guys, there is no documentation on this, can you connect me to a dev?" and the support person was like, "There is no documentation on this... here's a press release?" and I was like, "Yes, I know, can I talk to someone?" and they were like, "*closes ticket*"
yeah, that's why I say skip the middle man of HubSpot and just roll your own
but yeah like thomas said it's really best for you to just build out your own setup

they aren't super technical

little more technical though
